text: it's called mountaintop removal mining
and the process is exactly how it sounds
workers literally blast the top off a
mountain to access the coal deposits
below that's what they want to do here
at Coal River Mountain in southern West
Virginia when I learned that Massey
Energy was going to blow the top off my
Mountain I was thrust into this movement
Louella Scarborough comes from a coal
family her husband worked in the mines
and he died of black lung in 1999 this
is the face of coal I am NOT against
responsible coal mining when I husband
did that for 35 years I am 100% opposed
to mountaintop removal
that's because mountaintop removal has
become increasingly common and
increasingly controversial across
Appalachia here in West Virginia miss
Scarborough and others are looking for
an alternative that will provide new
jobs and help win the state office
dependence on coal their goal is to use
a wind farm to both generate electricity
and to block what they see as the
destruction of their mountain success
would be a way for the people that we
love to make a living without destroying
everything around us building windmills
might make it appear to you if you're
looking at the windmill that you created
a job but somewhere down the line you
cost somebody their job it's all on the
record Don Blankenship is the chief
executive of Massey Energy the largest
coal company in the state he took us out
to one of his former surface mine
operations they say it destroys the
landscape it pollutes the environment
how do you respond to those concerns
well I don't think you can put them back
as good as God put them there but I
think that generally speaking the
environmental damage is far less than
the value of the mining the value of the
domestic energy the value of the
inexpensive electricity the jobs all the
national security that comes from having
domestic energy so but a growing body of
evidence is confirming that mountaintop
removal mining damages the land and
pollutes the water critics argue that
mr. Blankenship
is in accounting for all the costs if
the health costs attributable to coal
pollution were assigned to coal and the
total environmental costs assigned to
coal then we'd find that coal is more
expensive than renewable energy Allen
twiddle is a member of the West Virginia
Public Energy Authority he supports
activists like Miss Scarborough but
knows that the odds are against them
they're a wonderful group of dedicated
people without much money and therein
lies their problem just because you're
right doesn't mean you know that you're
going to win this Scarborough is not
just up against Massey Energy but many
of her neighbors in the region and I'm
saying it right now if they stop to go
we all will be aided arc wondering why
ernest ruff also lives at the base of
Coal River Mountain but he thinks that
the environmental cost for mountaintop
removal including water pollution are
overblown in fact when we stopped by he
volunteered to drink out of the stream
behind his house he's also very
skeptical of wind powers potential get
him a mountain put them all up there at
about 25 years from now I'll be watching
down from heaven when they turn them on
we are coal miners we know the coal
miners far better than the New Yorkers
far better than the guys that are tied
to our equipment tied to our trees in
Washington the Environmental Protection
Agency is making new mountain removal
permits harder to get but a permanent
ban remains far from certain back in
West Virginia though Massey has already
begun to blast on one part of coal River
Mountain advocates say that if it
continues the mountain will no longer be
suitable for wind power
someday Cole's going to run out and
we're going to have to have jobs we're
going to have to have energy when that
happens so why not start now
